    {
      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "apt",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. APT had several integer overflows and underflows while parsing .deb packages, aka GHSL-2020-168 GHSL-2020-169, in files apt-pkg/contrib/extracttar.cc, apt-pkg/deb/debfile.cc, and apt-pkg/contrib/arfile.cc. This issue affects: apt 1.2.32ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.2.32ubuntu0.2; 1.6.12ubuntu0 versions prior to 1.6.12ubuntu0.2; 2.0.2ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.0.2ubuntu0.2; 2.1.10ubuntu0 versions prior to 2.1.10ubuntu0.1;\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `apt` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27350)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1899193)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210108-0005/)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4808)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/usn/usn-4667-1)\n",

    {
      "title": "Improper Check for Dropped Privileges",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "bash",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in disable_priv_mode in shell.c in GNU Bash through 5.0 patch 11. By default, if Bash is run with its effective UID not equal to its real UID, it will drop privileges by setting its effective UID to its real UID. However, it does so incorrectly. On Linux and other systems that support \"saved UID\" functionality, the saved UID is not dropped. An attacker with command execution in the shell can use \"enable -f\" for runtime loading of a new builtin, which can be a shared object that calls setuid() and therefore regains privileges. However, binaries running with an effective UID of 0 are unaffected.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20200430-0003/)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-18276)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/bminor/bash/commit/951bdaad7a18cc0dc1036bba86b18b90874d39ff)\n- [MISC](http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/155498/Bash-5.0-Patch-11-Privilege-Escalation.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-wGtxJ8opa8)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-18276)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nIn GNU Coreutils through 8.29, chown-core.c in chown and chgrp does not prevent replacement of a plain file with a symlink during use of the POSIX \"-R -L\" options, which allows local users to modify the ownership of arbitrary files by leveraging a race condition.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-18018)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-18018)\n- [http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html](http://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/coreutils/2017-12/msg00045.html)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Information Exposure curl 7.1.1 to and including 7.75.0 is vulnerable to an \"Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor\" by leaking credentials in the HTTP Referer: header. libcurl does not strip off user credentials from the URL when automatically populating the Referer: HTTP request header field in outgoing HTTP requests, and therefore risks leaking sensitive data to the server that is the target of the second HTTP request.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `curl`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-22876)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/ITVWPVGLFISU5BJC2BXBRYSDXTXE2YGC/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KQUIOYX2KUU6FIUZVB5WWZ6JHSSYSQWJ/)\n- [MISC](https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2021-22876.html)\n- [MISC](https://hackerone.com/reports/1101882)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in elfutils 0.175. A segmentation fault can occur in the function elf64_xlatetom in libelf/elf32_xlatetom.c, due to dwfl_segment_report_module not checking whether the dyn data read from a core file is truncated. A crafted input can cause a program crash, leading to denial-of-service, as demonstrated by eu-stack.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/02/msg00036.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7150)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24103)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/ml/elfutils-devel/2019-q1/msg00070.html)\n- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2197)\n- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3575)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-06/msg00052.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-7150)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4012-1/)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn attempted excessive memory allocation was discovered in the function read_long_names in elf_begin.c in libelf in elfutils 0.174. Remote attackers could leverage this vulnerability to cause a denial-of-service via crafted elf input, which leads to an out-of-memory exception. NOTE: The maintainers believe this is not a real issue, but instead a \"warning caused by ASAN because the allocation is big. By setting ASAN_OPTIONS=allocator_may_return_null=1 and running the reproducer, nothing happens.\"\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-7148)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24085)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nexpat 2.1.0 and earlier does not properly handle entities expansion unless an application developer uses the XML_SetEntityDeclHandler function, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (resource consumption), send HTTP requests to intranet servers, or read arbitrary files via a crafted XML document, aka an XML External Entity (XXE) issue.  NOTE: it could be argued that because expat already provides the ability to disable external entity expansion, the responsibility for resolving this issue lies with application developers; according to this argument, this entry should be REJECTed, and each affected application would need its own CVE.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2013-0340)\n- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201701-21)\n- [OSS security Advisory](http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/02/22/3)\n- [OSS security Advisory](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2013/04/12/6)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/58233)\n- [http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213](http://securitytracker.com/id?1028213)\n- [http://www.osvdb.org/90634](http://www.osvdb.org/90634)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nstack_protect_prologue in cfgexpand.c and stack_protect_epilogue in function.c in GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) 4.1 through 8 (under certain circumstances) generate instruction sequences when targeting ARM targets that spill the address of the stack protector guard, which allows an attacker to bypass the protection of -fstack-protector, -fstack-protector-all, -fstack-protector-strong, and -fstack-protector-explicit against stack overflow by controlling what the stack canary is compared against.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://gcc.gnu.org/viewcvs/gcc/trunk/gcc/config/arm/arm-protos.h?revision=266379&view=markup)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-12886)\n- [MISC](https://www.gnu.org/software/gcc/gcc-8/changes.html)\n",

    {
      "title": "Link Following",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "git",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Link Following. Git is an open-source distributed revision control system. In affected versions of Git a specially crafted repository that contains symbolic links as well as files using a clean/smudge filter such as Git LFS, may cause just-checked out script to be executed while cloning onto a case-insensitive file system such as NTFS, HFS+ or APFS (i.e. the default file systems on Windows and macOS). Note that clean/smudge filters have to be configured for that. Git for Windows configures Git LFS by default, and is therefore vulnerable. The problem has been patched in the versions published on Tuesday, March 9th, 2021. As a workaound, if symbolic link support is disabled in Git (e.g. via `git config --global core.symlinks false`), the described attack won't work. Likewise, if no clean/smudge filters such as Git LFS are configured globally (i.e. _before_ cloning), the attack is foiled. As always, it is best to avoid cloning repositories from untrusted sources. The earliest impacted version is 2.14.2. The fix versions are: 2.30.1, 2.29.3, 2.28.1, 2.27.1, 2.26.3, 2.25.5, 2.24.4, 2.23.4, 2.22.5, 2.21.4, 2.20.5, 2.19.6, 2.18.5, 2.17.62.17.6.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `git`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-21300)\n- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-8prw-h3cq-mghm)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BBPNGLQSYJHLZZ37BO42YY6S5OTIF4L4/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/LCLJJLKKMS5WRFO6C475AOUZTWQLIARX/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/LMXX2POK5X576BSDWSXGU7EIK6I72ERU/)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/git/git/commit/684dd4c2b414bcf648505e74498a608f28de4592)\n- [MISC](https://git-scm.com/docs/gitattributes#_filter)\n- [MISC](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-config#Documentation/git-config.txt-coresymlinks)\n- [MISC](https://lore.kernel.org/git/xmqqim6019yd.fsf@gitster.c.googlers.com/)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/03/09/3)\n",

    {
      "title": "Insufficiently Protected Credentials",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "git",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAffected versions of Git have a vulnerability whereby Git can be tricked into sending private credentials to a host controlled by an attacker. Git uses external \"credential helper\" programs to store and retrieve passwords or other credentials from secure storage provided by the operating system. Specially-crafted URLs that contain an encoded newline can inject unintended values into the credential helper protocol stream, causing the credential helper to retrieve the password for one server (e.g., good.example.com) for an HTTP request being made to another server (e.g., evil.example.com), resulting in credentials for the former being sent to the latter. There are no restrictions on the relationship between the two, meaning that an attacker can craft a URL that will present stored credentials for any host to a host of their choosing. The vulnerability can be triggered by feeding a malicious URL to git clone. However, the affected URLs look rather suspicious; the likely vector would be through systems which automatically clone URLs not visible to the user, such as Git submodules, or package systems built around Git. The problem has been patched in the versions published on April 14th, 2020, going back to v2.17.x. Anyone wishing to backport the change further can do so by applying commit 9a6bbee (the full release includes extra checks for git fsck, but that commit is sufficient to protect clients against the vulnerability). The patched versions are: 2.17.4, 2.18.3, 2.19.4, 2.20.3, 2.21.2, 2.22.3, 2.23.2, 2.24.2, 2.25.3, 2.26.1.\n\n## References\n- [Apple Security Advisory](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211141)\n- [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4657)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/04/msg00010.html)\n- [Debian Security     {
      "title": "Insufficiently Protected Credentials",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "git",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAffected versions of Git have a vulnerability whereby Git can be tricked into sending private credentials to a host controlled by an attacker. This bug is similar to CVE-2020-5260(GHSA-qm7j-c969-7j4q). The fix for that bug still left the door open for an exploit where _some_ credential is leaked (but the attacker cannot control which one). Git uses external \"credential helper\" programs to store and retrieve passwords or other credentials from secure storage provided by the operating system. Specially-crafted URLs that are considered illegal as of the recently published Git versions can cause Git to send a \"blank\" pattern to helpers, missing hostname and protocol fields. Many helpers will interpret this as matching _any_ URL, and will return some unspecified stored password, leaking the password to an attacker's server. The vulnerability can be triggered by feeding a malicious URL to `git clone`. However, the affected URLs look rather suspicious; the likely vector would be through systems which automatically clone URLs not visible to the user, such as Git submodules, or package systems built around Git. The root of the problem is in Git itself, which should not be feeding blank input to helpers. However, the ability to exploit the vulnerability in practice depends on which helpers are in use. Credential helpers which are known to trigger the vulnerability: - Git's \"store\" helper - Git's \"cache\" helper - the \"osxkeychain\" helper that ships in Git's \"contrib\" directory Credential helpers which are known to be safe even with vulnerable versions of Git: - Git Credential Manager for Windows Any helper not in this list should be assumed to trigger the vulnerability.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211183)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/04/msg00015.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11008)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/May/41)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/74Q7WVJ6FKLIN62VS2JD2XCNWK5TNKOW/)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/MOCTR2SEHCPSCOVUQJAGFPGKFMI2VE6V/)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/PN3FUOXKX3AXTULYV53ACABER2W2FSOU/)\n- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202004-13)\n- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-hjc9-x69f-jqj7)\n- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-qm7j-c969-7j4q)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/git/git/commit/c44088ecc4b0722636e0a305f9608d3047197282)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-05/msg00003.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-11008)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4334-1/)\n",

        "git@1:2.11.0-3+deb9u4",
        "git/git-man@1:2.11.0-3+deb9u4"

      "isPatchable": false,

    {
      "title": "Link Following",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "git",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Link Following. Git is an open-source distributed revision control system. In affected versions of Git a specially crafted repository that contains symbolic links as well as files using a clean/smudge filter such as Git LFS, may cause just-checked out script to be executed while cloning onto a case-insensitive file system such as NTFS, HFS+ or APFS (i.e. the default file systems on Windows and macOS). Note that clean/smudge filters have to be configured for that. Git for Windows configures Git LFS by default, and is therefore vulnerable. The problem has been patched in the versions published on Tuesday, March 9th, 2021. As a workaound, if symbolic link support is disabled in Git (e.g. via `git config --global core.symlinks false`), the described attack won't work. Likewise, if no clean/smudge filters such as Git LFS are configured globally (i.e. _before_ cloning), the attack is foiled. As always, it is best to avoid cloning repositories from untrusted sources. The earliest impacted version is 2.14.2. The fix versions are: 2.30.1, 2.29.3, 2.28.1, 2.27.1, 2.26.3, 2.25.5, 2.24.4, 2.23.4, 2.22.5, 2.21.4, 2.20.5, 2.19.6, 2.18.5, 2.17.62.17.6.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `git`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-21300)\n- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-8prw-h3cq-mghm)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/BBPNGLQSYJHLZZ37BO42YY6S5OTIF4L4/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/LCLJJLKKMS5WRFO6C475AOUZTWQLIARX/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/LMXX2POK5X576BSDWSXGU7EIK6I72ERU/)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/git/git/commit/684dd4c2b414bcf648505e74498a608f28de4592)\n- [MISC](https://git-scm.com/docs/gitattributes#_filter)\n- [MISC](https://git-scm.com/docs/git-config#Documentation/git-config.txt-coresymlinks)\n- [MISC](https://lore.kernel.org/git/xmqqim6019yd.fsf@gitster.c.googlers.com/)\n- [MLIST](http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2021/03/09/3)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAffected versions of Git have a vulnerability whereby Git can be tricked into sending private credentials to a host controlled by an attacker. Git uses external \"credential helper\" programs to store and retrieve passwords or other credentials from secure storage provided by the operating system. Specially-crafted URLs that contain an encoded newline can inject unintended values into the credential helper protocol stream, causing the credential helper to retrieve the password for one server (e.g., good.example.com) for an HTTP request being made to another server (e.g., evil.example.com), resulting in credentials for the former being sent to the latter. There are no restrictions on the relationship between the two, meaning that an attacker can craft a URL that will present stored credentials for any host to a host of their choosing. The vulnerability can be triggered by feeding a malicious URL to git clone. However, the affected URLs look rather suspicious; the likely vector would be through systems which automatically clone URLs not visible to the user, such as Git submodules, or package systems built around Git. The problem has been patched in the versions published on April 14th, 2020, going back to v2.17.x. Anyone wishing to backport the change further can do so by applying commit 9a6bbee (the full release includes extra checks for git fsck, but that commit is sufficient to protect clients against the vulnerability). The patched versions are: 2.17.4, 2.18.3, 2.19.4, 2.20.3, 2.21.2, 2.22.3, 2.23.2, 2.24.2, 2.25.3, 2.26.1.\n\n## References\n- [Apple Security Advisory](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211141)\n- [Debian Security Advisory](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4657)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/04/msg00010.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-5260)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7TVS5UG6JD3MYIGSBKMIOS6AF7CR5IPI/)\n- [Fedora Security     {
      "title": "Insufficiently Protected Credentials",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "git",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAffected versions of Git have a vulnerability whereby Git can be tricked into sending private credentials to a host controlled by an attacker. This bug is similar to CVE-2020-5260(GHSA-qm7j-c969-7j4q). The fix for that bug still left the door open for an exploit where _some_ credential is leaked (but the attacker cannot control which one). Git uses external \"credential helper\" programs to store and retrieve passwords or other credentials from secure storage provided by the operating system. Specially-crafted URLs that are considered illegal as of the recently published Git versions can cause Git to send a \"blank\" pattern to helpers, missing hostname and protocol fields. Many helpers will interpret this as matching _any_ URL, and will return some unspecified stored password, leaking the password to an attacker's server. The vulnerability can be triggered by feeding a malicious URL to `git clone`. However, the affected URLs look rather suspicious; the likely vector would be through systems which automatically clone URLs not visible to the user, such as Git submodules, or package systems built around Git. The root of the problem is in Git itself, which should not be feeding blank input to helpers. However, the ability to exploit the vulnerability in practice depends on which helpers are in use. Credential helpers which are known to trigger the vulnerability: - Git's \"store\" helper - Git's \"cache\" helper - the \"osxkeychain\" helper that ships in Git's \"contrib\" directory Credential helpers which are known to be safe even with vulnerable versions of Git: - Git Credential Manager for Windows Any helper not in this list should be assumed to trigger the vulnerability.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT211183)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/04/msg00015.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-11008)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2020/May/41)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/74Q7WVJ6FKLIN62VS2JD2XCNWK5TNKOW/)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/MOCTR2SEHCPSCOVUQJAGFPGKFMI2VE6V/)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/PN3FUOXKX3AXTULYV53ACABER2W2FSOU/)\n- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202004-13)\n- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-hjc9-x69f-jqj7)\n- [GitHub Advisory](https://github.com/git/git/security/advisories/GHSA-qm7j-c969-7j4q)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/git/git/commit/c44088ecc4b0722636e0a305f9608d3047197282)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-05/msg00003.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-11008)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4334-1/)\n",

The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `glibc`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Reachable Assertion. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system.       "description": "## Overview\nIn the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) through 2.28, the getaddrinfo function would successfully parse a string that contained an IPv4 address followed by whitespace and arbitrary characters, which could lead applications to incorrectly assume that it had parsed a valid string, without the possibility of embedded HTTP headers or other potentially dangerous substrings.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-10739)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=20018)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-04/msg00082.html)\n- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3513)\n- [RHSA Security Advisory](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:2118)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1347549)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106672)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2016-10739)\n",

    {
      "title": "Integer Underflow",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "glibc",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620)\n- [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Loop with Unreachable Exit Condition ('Infinite Loop'). The iconv function in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.32 and earlier, when processing invalid multi-byte input sequences in IBM1364, IBM1371, IBM1388, IBM1390, and IBM1399 encodings, fails to advance the input state, which could lead to an infinite loop in applications, resulting in a denial of service, a different vulnerability from CVE-2016-10228.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `glibc`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-27618)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20210401-0006/)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=19519#c21)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26224)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nA use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out. Directory paths containing an initial tilde followed by a valid username were affected by this issue.       "title": "Integer Underflow",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "glibc",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620)\n- [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Double Free. The nameserver caching daemon (nscd) in the GNU C Library (aka glibc or libc6) 2.29 through 2.33, when processing a request for netgroup lookup, may crash due to a double-free, potentially resulting in degraded service or Denial of Service on the local system. This is related to netgroupcache.c.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `glibc`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-27645)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/I7TS26LIZSOBLGJEZMJX4PXT5BQDE2WS/)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=27462)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nA use-after-free vulnerability introduced in glibc upstream version 2.14 was found in the way the tilde expansion was carried out.     {
      "title": "Integer Underflow",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "glibc",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn exploitable signed comparison vulnerability exists in the ARMv7 memcpy() implementation of GNU glibc 2.30.9000. Calling memcpy() (on ARMv7 targets that utilize the GNU glibc implementation) with a negative value for the 'num' parameter results in a signed comparison vulnerability. If an attacker underflows the 'num' parameter to memcpy(), this vulnerability could lead to undefined behavior such as writing to out-of-bounds memory and potentially remote code execution. Furthermore, this memcpy() implementation allows for program execution to continue in scenarios where a segmentation fault or crash should have occurred. The dangers occur in that subsequent execution and iterations of this code will be executed with this corrupted data.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-6096)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/SPYXTDOOB4PQGTYAMZAZNJIB3FF6YQXI/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/URXOIA2LDUKHQXK4BE55BQBRI6ZZG3Y6/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202101-20)\n- [MISC](https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=25620)\n- [MISC](https://www.talosintelligence.com/vulnerability_reports/TALOS-2020-1019)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n",

This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in after commit 4a4bb874f63741026bd26264c43bb32b1099f060.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-1000858)\n- [MISC](https://sektioneins.de/en/advisories/advisory-012018-gnupg-wkd.html)\n- [MISC](https://sektioneins.de/en/blog/18-11-23-gnupg-wkd.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-1000858)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3853-1/)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nThe SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a \"BEAST\" attack.\n\n## References\n-       "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nThe SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a \"BEAST\" attack.\n\n## References\n-       "description": "## Overview\nA vulnerability was found in gnutls versions from 3.5.8 before 3.6.7. A memory corruption (double free) vulnerability in the certificate verification API. Any client or server application that verifies X.509 certificates with GnuTLS 3.5.8 or later is affected.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://gitlab.com/gnutls/gnutls/issues/694)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190619-0004/)\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-3829)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-3829)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/A3ETBUFBB4G7AITAOUYPGXVMBGVXKUAN/)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/L7TJIBRJWGWSH6XIO2MXIQ3W6ES4R6I4/)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/WRSOL66LHP4SD3Y2ECJDOGT4K663ECDU/)\n- [Gentoo Security Advisory](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/201904-14)\n- [MISC](https://www.gnutls.org/security-new.html%23GNUTLS-SA-2019-03-27)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)\n- [REDHAT](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHSA-2019:3600)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2019-3829)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-3829)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/3999-1/)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nA Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way gnutls handles verification of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this to extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16868)\n- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00017.html)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-05/msg00068.html)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16868)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106080)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16868)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nThe SSL protocol, as used in certain configurations in Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Internet Explorer, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome, Opera, and other products, encrypts data by using CBC mode with chained initialization vectors, which allows man-in-the-middle attackers to obtain plaintext HTTP headers via a blockwise chosen-boundary attack (BCBA) on an HTTPS session, in conjunction with JavaScript code that uses (1) the HTML5 WebSocket API, (2) the Java URLConnection API, or (3) the Silverlight WebClient API, aka a \"BEAST\" attack.\n\n## References\n-       "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nA Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](http://krbdev.mit.edu/rt/Ticket/Display.html?id=8763)\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20217)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/01/msg00020.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-20217)\n- [Fedora Security Update](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/2KNHELH4YHNT6H2ESJWX2UIDXLBNGB2O/)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/5e6d1796106df8ba6bc1973ee0917c170d929086)\n- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190416-0006/)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-20217)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nplugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)\n- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)\n- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [

      "packageName": "krb5",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "packageName": "krb5",

      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nplugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)\n- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)\n- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)\n",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Uncontrolled Recursion. MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17.2 and 1.18.x before 1.18.3 allows unbounded recursion via an ASN.1-encoded Kerberos message because the lib/krb5/asn.1/asn1_encode.c support for BER indefinite lengths lacks a recursion limit.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `krb5` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-28196)\n- [CONFIRM](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/57415dda6cf04e73ffc3723be518eddfae599bfd)\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20201202-0001/)\n- [DEBIAN](https://www.debian.org/security/2020/dsa-4795)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/45KKOZQWIIIW5C45PJVGQ32AXBSYNBE7/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/73IGOG6CZAVMVNS4GGRMOLOZ7B6QVA7F/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/KPH2V3WSQTELROZK3GFCPQDOFLKIZ6H5/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202011-17)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2020/11/msg00011.html)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nplugins/preauth/pkinit/pkinit_crypto_openssl.c in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.15.2 mishandles Distinguished Name (DN) fields, which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) in situations involving untrusted X.509 data, related to the get_matching_data and X509_NAME_oneline_ex functions. NOTE: this has security relevance only in use cases outside of the MIT Kerberos distribution, e.g., the use of get_matching_data in KDC certauth plugin code that is specific to Red Hat.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2017-15088)\n- [Debian Bug Report](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=871698)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-15088)\n- [GitHub Commit](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/commit/fbb687db1088ddd894d975996e5f6a4252b9a2b4)\n- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/krb5/krb5/pull/707)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1504045)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/101594)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2017-15088)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) through 1.16. There is a variable \"dbentry->n_key_data\" in kadmin/dbutil/dump.c that can store 16-bit data but unknowingly the developer has assigned a \"u4\" variable to it, which is for 32-bit data. An attacker can use this vulnerability to affect other artifacts of the database as we know that a Kerberos database dump file contains trusted data.\n\n## References\n- [CVE Details](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-5709)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-5709)\n- [GitHub Additional Information](https://github.com/poojamnit/Kerberos-V5-1.16-Vulnerabilities/tree/master/Integer%20Overflow)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/rf9fa47ab66495c78bb4120b0754dd9531ca2ff0430f6685ac9b07772@%3Cdev.mina.apache.org%3E)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-5709)\n",

      "title": "Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm",
      "credit": [
        ""

      "packageName": "libgcrypt20",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\ncipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6829)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal/wiki)\n- [MISC](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2018-February/004394.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html)\n",

      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\ncipher/elgamal.c in Libgcrypt through 1.8.2, when used to encrypt messages directly, improperly encodes plaintexts, which allows attackers to obtain sensitive information by reading ciphertext data (i.e., it does not have semantic security in face of a ciphertext-only attack). The Decisional Diffie-Hellman (DDH) assumption does not hold for Libgcrypt's ElGamal implementation.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-6829)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/weikengchen/attack-on-libgcrypt-elgamal/wiki)\n- [MISC](https://lists.gnupg.org/pipermail/gcrypt-devel/2018-February/004394.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpujan2020.html)\n",

      "title": "Out-of-bounds Read",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "libssh2",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nIn libssh2 before 1.9.0, kex_method_diffie_hellman_group_exchange_sha256_key_exchange in kex.c has an integer overflow that could lead to an out-of-bounds read in the way packets are read from the server. A remote attacker who compromises a SSH server may be able to disclose sensitive information or cause a denial of service condition on the client system when a user connects to the server. This is related to an _libssh2_check_length mistake, and is different from the various issues fixed in 1.8.1, such as CVE-2019-3855.\n\n## References\n- [CONFIRM](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190806-0002/)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K13322484)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K13322484?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/07/msg00024.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13115)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/6LUNHPW64IGCASZ4JQ2J5KDXNZN53DWW/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/M7IF3LNHOA75O4WZWIHJLIRMA5LJUED3/)\n- [GitHub Diff](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/compare/02ecf17...42d37aa)\n- [GitHub PR](https://github.com/libssh2/libssh2/pull/350)\n- [MISC](https://blog.semmle.com/libssh2-integer-overflow/)\n- [MISC](https://libssh2.org/changes.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13115)\n",

      "title": "Integer Overflow or Wraparound",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "libx11",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in The X Input Method (XIM) client was implemented in libX11 before version 1.6.10. As per upstream this is security relevant when setuid programs call XIM client functions while running with elevated privileges. No such programs are shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `libx11` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-14344)\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14344)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14344)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4VDDSAYV7XGNRCXE7HCU23645MG74OFF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7AVXCQOSCAPKYYHFIJAZ6E2C7LJBTLXF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/XY4H2SIEF2362AMNX5ZKWAELGU7LKFJB/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-18)\n- [MISC](https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-July/003050.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/31/1)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00014.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00015.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00024.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00031.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-1/)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. An integer overflow vulnerability leading to a double-free was found in libX11. This flaw allows a local privileged attacker to cause an application compiled with libX11 to crash, or in some cases, result in arbitrary code execution. The highest threat from this flaw is to confidentiality, integrity as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `libx11` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14363)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14363)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7AVXCQOSCAPKYYHFIJAZ6E2C7LJBTLXF/)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/Ruia-ruia/Exploits/blob/master/DFX11details.txt)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/Ruia-ruia/Exploits/blob/master/x11doublefree.sh)\n- [MISC](https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-August/003056.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/)\n",

An integer overflow vulnerability leading to a double-free was found in libX11. This flaw allows a local privileged attacker to cause an application compiled with libX11 to crash, or in some cases, result in arbitrary code execution. The highest threat from this flaw is to confidentiality, integrity as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `libx11` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14363)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14363)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7AVXCQOSCAPKYYHFIJAZ6E2C7LJBTLXF/)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/Ruia-ruia/Exploits/blob/master/DFX11details.txt)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/Ruia-ruia/Exploits/blob/master/x11doublefree.sh)\n- [MISC](https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-August/003056.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/)\n",

An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in The X Input Method (XIM) client was implemented in libX11 before version 1.6.10. As per upstream this is security relevant when setuid programs call XIM client functions while running with elevated privileges. No such programs are shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `libx11` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-14344)\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14344)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14344)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4VDDSAYV7XGNRCXE7HCU23645MG74OFF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7AVXCQOSCAPKYYHFIJAZ6E2C7LJBTLXF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/XY4H2SIEF2362AMNX5ZKWAELGU7LKFJB/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-18)\n- [MISC](https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-July/003050.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/31/1)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00014.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00015.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00024.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00031.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-1/)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/)\n",

An integer overflow vulnerability leading to a double-free was found in libX11. This flaw allows a local privileged attacker to cause an application compiled with libX11 to crash, or in some cases, result in arbitrary code execution. The highest threat from this flaw is to confidentiality, integrity as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `libx11` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14363)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14363)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7AVXCQOSCAPKYYHFIJAZ6E2C7LJBTLXF/)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/Ruia-ruia/Exploits/blob/master/DFX11details.txt)\n- [MISC](https://github.com/Ruia-ruia/Exploits/blob/master/x11doublefree.sh)\n- [MISC](https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-August/003056.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Integer Overflow or Wraparound. An integer overflow leading to a heap-buffer overflow was found in The X Input Method (XIM) client was implemented in libX11 before version 1.6.10. As per upstream this is security relevant when setuid programs call XIM client functions while running with elevated privileges. No such programs are shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux.\n## Remediation\nUpgrade `libx11` to version  or higher.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2020-14344)\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-14344)\n- [CONFIRM](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2020-14344)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/4VDDSAYV7XGNRCXE7HCU23645MG74OFF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/7AVXCQOSCAPKYYHFIJAZ6E2C7LJBTLXF/)\n- [FEDORA](https://lists.fedoraproject.org/archives/list/package-announce@lists.fedoraproject.org/message/XY4H2SIEF2362AMNX5ZKWAELGU7LKFJB/)\n- [GENTOO](https://security.gentoo.org/glsa/202008-18)\n- [MISC](https://lists.x.org/archives/xorg-announce/2020-July/003050.html)\n- [MISC](https://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2020/07/31/1)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00014.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00015.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00024.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-08/msg00031.html)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-1/)\n- [UBUNTU](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4487-2/)\n",

      "title": "Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "nettle",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm. A flaw was found in Nettle in versions before 3.7.2, where several Nettle signature verification functions (GOST DSA, EDDSA & ECDSA) result in the Elliptic Curve Cryptography point (ECC) multiply function being called with out-of-range scalers, possibly resulting in incorrect results. This flaw allows an attacker to force an invalid signature, causing an assertion failure or possible validation. The highest threat to this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `nettle`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20305)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1942533)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nA Bleichenbacher type side-channel based padding oracle attack was found in the way nettle handles endian conversion of RSA decrypted PKCS#1 v1.5 data. An attacker who is able to run a process on the same physical core as the victim process, could use this flaw extract plaintext or in some cases downgrade any TLS connections to a vulnerable server.\n\n## References\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2018-16869)\n- [MISC](http://cat.eyalro.net/)\n- [RedHat Bugzilla Bug](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=CVE-2018-16869)\n- [Security Focus](http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/106092)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2018-16869)\n",

      "title": "Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "nettle",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm. A flaw was found in Nettle in versions before 3.7.2, where several Nettle signature verification functions (GOST DSA, EDDSA & ECDSA) result in the Elliptic Curve Cryptography point (ECC) multiply function being called with out-of-range scalers, possibly resulting in incorrect results. This flaw allows an attacker to force an invalid signature, causing an assertion failure or possible validation. The highest threat to this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `nettle`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-20305)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1942533)\n",

      "title": "Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling",

      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nSome HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to window size manipulation and stream prioritization manipulation, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker requests a large amount of data from a specified resource over multiple streams. They manipulate window size and stream priority to force the server to queue the data in 1-byte chunks. Depending on how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excess CPU, memory, or both.\n\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-9511)\n-       "title": "Resource Exhaustion",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "nghttp2",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nSome HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to resource loops, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker creates multiple request streams and continually shuffles the priority of the streams in a way that causes substantial churn to the priority tree. This can consume excess CPU.\n\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-9513)\n- [BUGTRAQ](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Sep/1)\n- [Bugtraq Mailing       "title": "Improper Authentication",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "openldap",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in OpenLDAP 2.x before 2.4.48. When using SASL authentication and session encryption, and relying on the SASL security layers in slapd access controls, it is possible to obtain access that would otherwise be denied via a simple bind for any identity covered in those ACLs. After the first SASL bind is completed, the sasl_ssf value is retained for all new non-SASL connections. Depending on the ACL configuration, this can affect different types of operations (searches, modifications, etc.). In other words, a successful authorization step completed by one user affects the authorization requirement for a different user.\n\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13565)\n- [BUGTRAQ](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Dec/23)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT210788)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K98008862?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openldap.org/lists/openldap-announce/201907/msg00001.html)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/08/msg00024.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13565)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Dec/26)\n- [MISC](https://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi/?findid=9052)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r1b103833cb5bc8466e24ff0ecc5e75b45a705334ab6a444e64e840a0@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00053.html)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00058.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13565)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4078-1/)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4078-2/)\n",

When the server administrator delegates rootDN (database admin) privileges for certain databases but wants to maintain isolation (e.g., for multi-tenant deployments), slapd does not properly stop a rootDN from requesting authorization as an identity from another database during a SASL bind or with a proxyAuthz (RFC 4370) control.       "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\n\nAffected versions of this package are vulnerable to Improper Certificate Validation libldap in certain third-party OpenLDAP packages has a certificate-validation flaw when the third-party package is asserting RFC6125 support. It considers CN even when there is a non-matching subjectAltName (SAN). This is fixed in, for example, openldap-2.4.46-10.el8 in Red Hat Enterprise Linux.\n## Remediation\nThere is no fixed version for `openldap`.\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-15719)\n- [MISC](https://access.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2019:3674)\n- [MISC](https://bugs.openldap.org/show_bug.cgi?id=9266)\n- [MISC](https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1740070)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00033.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2020-09/msg00059.html)\n",

    {
      "title": "Improper Authentication",
      "credit": [
        ""
      ],
      "packageName": "openldap",
      "language": "linux",
      "packageManager": "debian:9",
      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in OpenLDAP 2.x before 2.4.48. When using SASL authentication and session encryption, and relying on the SASL security layers in slapd access controls, it is possible to obtain access that would otherwise be denied via a simple bind for any identity covered in those ACLs. After the first SASL bind is completed, the sasl_ssf value is retained for all new non-SASL connections. Depending on the ACL configuration, this can affect different types of operations (searches, modifications, etc.). In other words, a successful authorization step completed by one user affects the authorization requirement for a different user.\n\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13565)\n- [BUGTRAQ](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Dec/23)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT210788)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K98008862?utm_source=f5support&amp%3Butm_medium=RSS)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openldap.org/lists/openldap-announce/201907/msg00001.html)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/08/msg00024.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13565)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Dec/26)\n- [MISC](https://www.openldap.org/its/index.cgi/?findid=9052)\n- [MLIST](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/r1b103833cb5bc8466e24ff0ecc5e75b45a705334ab6a444e64e840a0@%3Cissues.bookkeeper.apache.org%3E)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00053.html)\n- [OpenSuse Security Announcement](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00058.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13565)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4078-1/)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4078-2/)\n",

      "description": "## Overview\nAn issue was discovered in the server in OpenLDAP before 2.4.48. When the server administrator delegates rootDN (database admin) privileges for certain databases but wants to maintain isolation (e.g., for multi-tenant deployments), slapd does not properly stop a rootDN from requesting authorization as an identity from another database during a SASL bind or with a proxyAuthz (RFC 4370) control. (It is not a common configuration to deploy a system where the server administrator and a DB administrator enjoy different levels of trust.)\n\n## References\n- [ADVISORY](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2019-13057)\n- [BUGTRAQ](https://seclists.org/bugtraq/2019/Dec/23)\n- [CONFIRM](https://support.apple.com/kb/HT210788)\n- [CONFIRM](https://www.openldap.org/lists/openldap-announce/201907/msg00001.html)\n- [Debian Security Announcement](https://lists.debian.org/debian-lts-announce/2019/08/msg00024.html)\n- [Debian Security Tracker](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2019-13057)\n- [FULLDISC](http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2019/Dec/26)\n- [MISC](https://www.openldap.org/its/?findid=9038)\n- [N/A](https://www.oracle.com/security-alerts/cpuapr2020.html)\n- [Netapp Security Advisory](https://security.netapp.com/advisory/ntap-20190822-0004/)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00053.html)\n- [SUSE](http://lists.opensuse.org/opensuse-security-announce/2019-09/msg00058.html)\n- [Ubuntu CVE Tracker](http://people.ubuntu.com/~ubuntu-security/cve/CVE-2019-13057)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4078-1/)\n- [Ubuntu Security Advisory](https://usn.ubuntu.com/4078-2/)\n",
